oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Grape derived secondary metabolites are the principal sources of wine aroma, flavor, color and taste. Most of available data about phenolics are concerned mature berries. Nevertheless, the contribution of flavonols in metabolism may be important, not only in red berries, but especially in green, when the berries are most susceptible to different kind of stresses. The changes in phenol composition in green berries, under water stress conditions (Ojeda et al., 2001; in press) and with different training systems (Kraeva et al., 2001; submitted) have been observed.
